ActianMatrix.Name: Actian Matrix
ActianMatrix.Comment: formerly ParAccel (PaDB), now discontinued, massively parallel columnar RDBMS for analytic workloads

ActianVector.Name: Actian Vector
ActianVector.Comment: High-performance vectorized columnar analytics database with JDBC driver

DatacomDB.Name: Datacom/DB
DatacomDB.Comment: RDBMS for mainframes with JDBC driver (legacy system)

DBase.Name: dBASE
DBase.Comment: old RDBMS introduced for DOS and personal pc

OracleTimesTen.Name: Oracle TimesTen
OracleTimesTen.Comment: in-memory RDBMS with persistence & high availability with JDBC/ODBC drivers

SAPMaxDB.Name: SAP MaxDB
SAPMaxDB.Comment: RDBMS used with SAP applications, also separately available in closed source form

SASScalablePerformanceDataServer.Name: SAS Scalable Performance Data Server
SASScalablePerformanceDataServer.Comment: SAS server providing parallel access and computation on large datasets, using a relational model and accessible via JDBC

Vertica.Name: Vertica
Vertica.Comment: column-store MPP RDBMS with ODBC, JDBC, ADO.NET, and OLE DB interfaces

ClickHouse.Name: ClickHouse
ClickHouse.Comment: OS column-oriented C++ distributed OLAP store (not on Hadoop) powering Yandex, with JDBC driver

Druid.Name: Druid
Druid.Comment: OS column-oriented Java distributed OLAP store on Hadoop, suitable to time series and event data

Greenplum.Name: Greenplum
Greenplum.Comment: open-source analytic RDBMS built on PostgreSQL (Pivotal Greenplum Database)

Iceberg.Name: Iceberg
Iceberg.Comment: open-source table format specification, relying on a catalog that may be implemented using HIVE Metadata Store (or a RDBMS) and providing a Java library for manipulating tables; addresses issues of HIVE - not exactly a store but provides the basis of a store

Kudu.Name: Kudu
Kudu.Comment: OS column-oriented Java RDBMS on Hadoop accessible via JDBC using Impala

Pinot.Name: Pinot
Pinot.Comment: OS column-oriented Java distributed OLAP store on Hadoop, with JDBC driver

AlibabaAnalyticDBforMySQL.Name: Alibaba AnalyticDB for MySQL
AlibabaAnalyticDBforMySQL.Comment: relational cloud and SQL-based data warehouse solution compatible with MySQL client protocol

AlibabaDataLakeAnalytics.Name: Alibaba Data Lake Analytics
AlibabaDataLakeAnalytics.Comment: cloud-based analytics service integrated in Alibaba Cloud offer using SQL language and Presto or SPARK as query engines

AmazonAurora.Name: Amazon Aurora
AmazonAurora.Comment: cloud RDBMS and document store, compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL

AmazonRedshift.Name: Amazon Redshift
AmazonRedshift.Comment: large scale data warehouse service for use with business intelligence tools

Databricks.Name: Databricks
Databricks.Comment: cloud-based data lake platform from the creators of Spark, accessible via JDBC

IBMDBtwoWarehouse.Name: IBM Db2 Warehouse
IBMDBtwoWarehouse.Comment: relational data warehouse available also on cloud

Snowflake.Name: Snowflake
Snowflake.Comment: cloud-based relational data warehouse with JDBC driver

Teradata.Name: Teradata
Teradata.Comment: hybrid cloud data analytics software platform, primarily relational + document/graph/spatial/time series

TeradataAster.Name: Teradata Aster
TeradataAster.Comment: discontinued big data for relational data (graph data support claimed too) and different query engines, including one using MapReduce

TibcoComputeDB.Name: Tibco ComputeDB
TibcoComputeDB.Comment: distributed in-memory RDBMS for real-time operational analytics based on Apache Spark, with JDBC driver

Drill.Name: Drill
Drill.Comment: schema-free SQL query engine for Hadoop, NoSQL and cloud storage, RDBMS / document-store

Hive.Name: Hive
Hive.Comment: SQL on Hadopp, Java SQL engine suited to complex batch queries, memory+disk processing via MapReduce, Flink or Tez runtimes, with UDF, using Calcite, with JDBC driver

Impala.Name: Impala
Impala.Comment: SQL on Hadoop, C++/LLVM SQL engine suited for fast interactive queries, in-memory only, no UDF, with JDBC driver

JBossDataVirtualization.Name: JBoss Data Virtualization
JBossDataVirtualization.Comment: a relational DFS of this survey, formerly JBoss Enterprise Data Services Platform

Presto.Name: Presto
Presto.Comment: Distributed query engine for big data with a relational model and JDBC driver - Facebook / Linux Foundation

SparkSQL.Name: Spark
SparkSQL.Comment: Spark component for managing and querying structured data, via DSL and SQL, with JDBC/ODBC drivers

Teiid.Name: Teiid
Teiid.Comment: a system of this survey, presenting a relational interface

Trino.Name: Trino
Trino.Comment: Distributed query engine for big data with a relational model and JDBC driver - fork by original authors, commercially exploited by Starburst

AmazonAthena.Name: Amazon Athena
AmazonAthena.Comment: interactive query service (Presto ANSI SQL support) for data on S3, integrated with Amazon Glue and coming with JDBC driver

DataVirtuality.Name: Data Virtuality
DataVirtuality.Comment: data federation system of this survey, SQL based and likely accessed via its JDBC driver

Denodo.Name: Denodo
Denodo.Comment: Denodo Virtual DataPort, a system of this survey

IBMDbtwoBigSQL.Name: IBM Db2 Big SQL
IBMDbtwoBigSQL.Comment: ANSI-compliant SQL-on-Hadoop engine, included as data federation system in this survey -- DFS SYSTEM

IBMDVM.Name: IBM DVM
IBMDVM.Comment: IBM Data Virtualization Manager for z/OS - provides virtual, integrated views of data on IBM Z

MetaMatrix.Name: MetaMatrix
MetaMatrix.Comment: commercial legacy relational system later acquired by Red Hat and evolved into Teiid

SASFederationServer.Name: SAS Federation Server
SASFederationServer.Comment: a system of this survey, presenting a relational interface

TibcoDataVirtualization.Name: TibcoDataVirtualization
TibcoDataVirtualization.Comment: a system of this survey, presenting a relational interface

HPNeoview.Name: HP Neoview
HPNeoview.Comment: data warehouse HW+SW solution providing RDBMS capabilities and SQL interface, dismissed in 2011

IBMIntegratedAnalyticsSystem.Name: IBM Integrated Analytics System
IBMIntegratedAnalyticsSystem.Comment: HW+SW solution providing RDBMS capabilities, replacement of Netezza

IBMNetezza.Name: IBM Netezza
IBMNetezza.Comment: data warehouse RDBMS and analytics appliance by IBM with ODBC, JDBC, OLE DB interfaces

IBMPureData.Name: IBM PureData
IBMPureData.Comment: HW+SW solutions in different flavours providing OLTP/OLAP RDBMS capabilities

Yellowbrick.Name: Yellowbrick
Yellowbrick.Comment: data warehouse RDBMS with JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET drivers supplied as cloud server / appliance

MDX.Name: MDX
MDX.Comment: OLAP RDBMS accessed via Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) protocol & query language

MicrosoftAnalysisServices.Name: MS Analysis Service
MicrosoftAnalysisServices.Comment: OLAP server with MDX support, available on Azure or bundled with SQL Server

OracleEssbase.Name: Oracle Essbase
OracleEssbase.Comment: multidimensional OLAP RDBMS with JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET drivers, formerly by Hyperion

SAPBusinessWarehouse.Name: SAP Business Warehouse
SAPBusinessWarehouse.Comment: a.k.a. Business Intelligence -- relational data warehouse intended for loading, transforming and storing data modelled into cubes for analysis purposes, also supporting MDX and at a certain point temporarily named SAP BI (Business Intelligence) - see https://www.createch.ca/blog/whats-the-difference-between-sap-bi-sap-bw-sap-bo

Infinispan.Name: Infinispan
Infinispan.Comment: open source distributed cache and key-value NoSQL data store by Red Hat

OracleNoSQL.Name: Oracle NoSQL
OracleNoSQL.Comment: key-value store where values can be JSON or table rows, supporting distribution and secondary indexes

RedHatDataGrid.Name: Red Hat Data Grid
RedHatDataGrid.Comment: distributed caching solution, commercial version of Infinispan

Accumulo.Name: Accumulo
Accumulo.Comment: scalable sorted and distributed store based on Google Bigtable

AmazonSimpleDB.Name: Amazon SimpleDB
AmazonSimpleDB.Comment: cloud-based key-value store, still available but being phased out in favor of DynamoDB -- NOTE: sometimes classified as key-value store (but can store/query item columns!) and compared to DynamoDB (which is now a document-store)

Cassandra.Name: Cassandra
Cassandra.Comment: wide-column store based on ideas of BigTable and DynamoDB

HBase.Name: HBase
HBase.Comment: wide-column store based on Apache Hadoop and on concepts of BigTable

MapRDB.Name: MapR-DB
MapRDB.Comment: proprietary wide-column store, apparently derived from HBase and now rebranded

AmazonOpenSearch.Name: Amazon OpenSearch
AmazonOpenSearch.Comment: Elasticsearch on AWS, OpenSearch = Elasticsearch fork with ASLv2 license

Solr.Name: Solr
Solr.Comment: open source search engine indexing documents consisting of fields

Splunk.Name: Splunk
Splunk.Comment: indexing and search engine for event/log data, using inverted indexes and storing data as field-based documents

Avro.Name: Avro
Avro.Comment: open source RPC and data serialization framework

CommonLogFormat.Name: Common Log Format
CommonLogFormat.Comment: log file format for Apache & other HTTP servers

ENVI.Name: ENVI
ENVI.Comment: binary format for multidimensional raster data

Parquet.Name: Parquet
Parquet.Comment: open source column-oriented data storage format for Hadoop

RCFile.Name: RCFile
RCFile.Comment: file formats for tabular data that splits data by row groups first and then by columns (Record Columnar File)

SASBDAT.Name: SAS7BDAT
SASBDAT.Comment: database storage file created by SAS

SASXPT.Name: SAS XPT
SASXPT.Comment: SAS Transport File Format Family (XPORT, XPT)

SequenceFile.Name: SequenceFile
SequenceFile.Comment: flat file consisting of binary key/value pairs, used in Hadoop MapReduce

PDF.Name: PDF~(metadata)
PDF.Comment: single record with metadata of a PDF file

OData.Name: OData
OData.Comment: HTTP/REST services complying to OData specification

OpenAPI.Name: OpenAPI
OpenAPI.Comment: HTTP/REST services compliant with OpenAPI specification

HTTPREST.Name: HTTP~/ REST
HTTPREST.Comment: arbitrary HTTP-based web services using the REST paradigm, not compliant with OData or OpenAPI

SOAPWSDL.Name: SOAP~/ WSDL
SOAPWSDL.Comment: arbitrary XML-based (SOAP), RPC-style web services defined via a WSDL specification

AmazonTimestream.Name: Amazon Timestream
AmazonTimestream.Comment: time series database service for IoT & operational applications with JDBC support

Kdbplus.Name: Kdb+
Kdbplus.Comment: column-based, in-memory relational time series database with SQL like interface and JDBC driver

OpenTSDB.Name: OpenTSDB
OpenTSDB.Comment: open source time series DBMS based on HBase

Prometheus.Name: Prometheus
Prometheus.Comment: open source time series DBMS & monitoring system for other software components

IBMDBtwoEventStore.Name: IBM Db2 Event Store
IBMDBtwoEventStore.Comment: open source time series DBMS & monitoring system for other software components

SciDB.Name: SciDB
SciDB.Comment: scalable & distributed DBMS with multi-dimensional array data model

InterSystemsCache.Name: InterSystems Caché
InterSystemsCache.Comment: multi-model DBMS, popular as OODMBS and also usable as RDBMS and key-value store

IDMS.Name: IDMS
IDMS.Comment: network model (CODASYL) DBMS for mainframes (legacy system)

ModeShape.Name: ModeShape
ModeShape.Comment: Open source JCR implementation, supporting a SQL-like language to query nodes in the repository

AmazonKinesis.Name: Amazon Kinesis
AmazonKinesis.Comment: cloud service for real-time processing of big data streams

SAPHANAStreamingAnalytics.Name: SAP HANA Streaming Analytics
SAPHANAStreamingAnalytics.Comment: formerly SAP Event Stream Processor https://help.sap.com/viewer/product/SAP_EVENT_STREAM_PROCESSOR/5.1.12/en-US]{SAP HANA Streaming Analytics

AmazonAWSSystemsManagerInventory.Name: Amazon AWS System Manager Inventory
AmazonAWSSystemsManagerInventory.Comment: cloud service collecting metadata of all resources used by an AWS customer

AmazonCloudWatch.Name: Amazon CloudWatch
AmazonCloudWatch.Comment: cloud service collecting logs and metrics from other machines/services

BioRS.Name: BioRS
BioRS.Comment: query & retrieval system for integrating biological and medical data by Biomax Informatics (dismissed or merged into other product)

Eloqua.Name: Eloqua
Eloqua.Comment: SaaS platform for marketing automation for supporting marketing campaigns and sales lead generation, from Oracle

GoogleContactsAPI.Name: Google Contacts
GoogleContactsAPI.Comment: now migrated to People API https://developers.google.com/people

HubSpot.Name: HubSpot
HubSpot.Comment: software for CRM, inbound marketing, and sales

Netsuite.Name: NetSuite
Netsuite.Comment: cloud business management suite comprising ERP/Financials, CRM and ecommerce, used by more than 28,000 customers, owned by Oracle

OSIsoftPI.Name: OSIsoft PI
OSIsoftPI.Comment: suite of software products for capturing, processing, analyzing, and storing real-time data, focusing in industrial settings and with data exposed (also) via JDBC interface (assuming a fixed schema)

Salesforce.Name: Salesforce
Salesforce.Comment: cloud data source with relational model and support for ODBC/JDBC ccess (Salesforce CDP - Customer Data Platform)

AllegroGraph.Name: AllegroGraph
AllegroGraph.Description: Distributed graph & document DB supporting OWL, SPARQL, SHACL and federation

Amazon Athena.Name: Amazon Athena
Amazon Athena.Description: Inter. cloud query service for Amazon S3 data, based on Presto

Amazon Neptune.Name: Amazon Neptune
Amazon Neptune.Description: Fully-managed cloud graph DB (property graph, RDF), part of Amazon AWS

AnzoGraph DB.Name: AnzoGraph DB
AnzoGraph DB.Description: Massively-parallel distributed graph DB (property-graph, RDF) for large-scale analytics

Apache Drill.Name: Apache Drill
Apache Drill.Description: Distributed schema-free engine for interactive SQL queries on heterogeneous & nested data, inspired by Dremel

Apache Jena.Name: Apache Jena
Apache Jena.Description: SPARQL query engine of Jena framework and TDB triple store, supporting federation

Apache Spark.Name: Apache Spark
Apache Spark.Description: Multi-lang. (incl. SQL) distributed engine for large-scale data processing & analytics

BigDAWG.Name: BigDAWG
BigDAWG.Provider: Intel Science & Technology Center for Big data
BigDAWG.Description: Polystore with heterogeneous storage engines for time series (SciDB), text (Accumulo) and relational data (PostgreSQL)

Blazegraph.Name: Blazegraph
Blazegraph.Description: Triple store supporting SPARQL 1.1 federation and powering Wikidata (via a fork)

CloudMdsQL.Name: CloudMdsQL
CloudMdsQL.Description: Polystore integrating heterogeneous storage engines (incl. RDBMS, NoSQL, HDFS)

Comunica.Name: Comunica
Comunica.Description: Modular JS federated query engine for heterogeneous web sources, incl. SPARQL endpoints

CostFed.Name: CostFed
CostFed.Description: Index-assisted, cost-based data federation system for SPARQL endpoints

DARQ.Name: DARQ
DARQ.Description: Earliest data federation system for SPARQL endpoints, cost-based

Data Virtuality.Name: Data Virtuality
Data Virtuality.Description: Heterogeneous data integration solution combining data virtualization and ETL

Denodo.Name: Denodo
Denodo.Description: Data virtualization solution for heterogeneous sources, also available as cloud service

Dremio.Name: Dremio
Dremio.Description: Data ``lakehouse'' (lake + warehouse) solution supporting heterogeneous data sources

FEDRA.Name: FEDRA
FEDRA.Description: Data federation system for SPARQL endpoints exploiting data replication

FedX~(RDF4J).Name: FedX~(RDF4J)
FedX~(RDF4J).Description: On-demand (no statistics, query-time) data federation system for SPARQL endpoints

GraphDB.Name: GraphDB
GraphDB.Description: Triple store featuring OWL reasoning, SPARQL federated queries & RDBMS access

HiBISCuS.Name: HiBISCuS
HiBISCuS.Description: Source selection for SPARQL data federation (DARQ, FedX & SPLENDID extension)

IBM Cloud Pak for Data.Name: IBM Cloud Pak for Data
IBM Cloud Pak for Data.Description: Data federation system with data discovery, governance, security and privacy solutions, also available as cloud service (formerly IBM Cloud Private for Data)

IBM Db2 Big SQL.Name: IBM Db2 Big SQL
IBM Db2 Big SQL.Description: Massively-parallel Hadoop SQL engine for heterogeneous sources (formerly IBM SQL)

IBM InfoSphere Federation Server.Name: IBM InfoSphere Federation Server
IBM InfoSphere Federation Server.Description: SQL-based data federation system for heterogeneous sources (formerly WebSphere Federation Server)

JBoss Data Virtualization.Name: JBoss Data Virtualization
JBoss Data Virtualization.Description: Data federation system based on Teiid and providing read/write access to heterogeneous sources, data security, and multiple user interfaces / APIs

Metaphactory.Name: Metaphactory
Metaphactory.Description: KG platform on top of SPARQL endpoints with two federation engines (Ephedra, FedX)

Myria.Name: Myria
Myria.Description: Cloud service for big data management/analytics with parallel & federated query engine

Neo4j (Fabric).Name: Neo4j (Fabric)
Neo4j (Fabric).Description: Federation solution of Neo4J graph DB (Cypher queries on property graph model)

Obi-Wan.Name: Obi-Wan
Obi-Wan.Description: Ontology-Based Data Access (OBDA) system on top of Tatooine mediator for heterogeneous sources

Odyssey.Name: Odyssey
Odyssey.Description: Statistics & cost-based optimizer for SPARQL data federation (FedX extension)

Ontario.Name: Ontario
Ontario.Description: Heuristics-based system using RDF Molecule Templates (introduced by its predecessor MULDER) to describe/map source content as star-shaped RDF instance descriptions

Onto-KIT.Name: Onto-KIT
Onto-KIT.Description: Data federation system focusing on Earth Observation data with hypergraph-based data model and query processing techniques

Oracle Big Data SQL.Name: Oracle Big Data SQL
Oracle Big Data SQL.Description: Data federation system for Oracle DB that accesses Hadoop storage & processing

Oracle DB (Spatial & Graph).Name: Oracle DB (Spatial & Graph)
Oracle DB (Spatial & Graph).Description: Oracle DB component for semantic technologies with data federation capabilities (RDF views) over relational, graph, and RDF (SPARQL) sources

PolyWeb.Name: PolyWeb
PolyWeb.Description: SPARQL-based data federation system for different sources on the Web (RDF & CSV data, RDBMS), focusing on source selection, query optimization & execution

Presto.Name: Presto
Presto.Description: SQL-based distributed query engine suitable to interactive (big) data analytics

Querona Data Virtualization.Name: Querona Data Virtualization
Querona Data Virtualization.Provider: YouNeedIT Sp. z o.o. Sp. k.
Querona Data Virtualization.Description: Data federation system for a variety of heterogeneous sources, based on Apache Spark and targeting big data analytics with the support of main BI tools

RDFLib.Name: RDFLib
RDFLib.Description: A pure Python package for working with RDF, supporting SPARQL 1.1 federation

SAFE.Name: SAFE
SAFE.Provider: Insight SFI Research Centre for Data Analytics
SAFE.Description: Data federation system for SPARQL endpoints exposing RDF data cubes with sensitive data, featuring access policy-aware data summaries, source selection & query execution

SAGE.Name: SAGE
SAGE.Description: SPARQL engine with ``web preemption'' (i.e., query suspend/resume) & federation capabilities

SAP HANA.Name: SAP HANA
SAP HANA.Description: In-memory DB targeting with data federation capabilities, also available as cloud service

SAS Federation Server.Name: SAS Federation Server
SAS Federation Server.Description: Data federation system featuring data caches, masking, encryption & quality functions

SemaGrow.Name: SemaGrow
SemaGrow.Description: Data federation system for SPARQL endpoints with statistics-based query optimization

SPLENDID.Name: SPLENDID
SPLENDID.Description: Data federation system for SPARQL endpoints that provide VOID data statistics

SQL Server (PolyBase).Name: SQL Server (PolyBase)
SQL Server (PolyBase).Description: SQL Server component for data federation supporting Hadoop and Azure storage

Squerall.Name: Squerall
Squerall.Description: Data federation system for heterogeneous sources built on Spark, Presto, and RML mappings

Starburst.Name: Starburst
Starburst.Description: Commercial distribution of Trino, extra security features, available on-premise/on-cloud

Stardog.Name: Stardog
Stardog.Description: KG platform including data federation of heterogeneous sources & query-time inference

Teiid.Name: Teiid
Teiid.Description: SQL-based engine for data federation of heterogeneous sources

TIBCO Data Virtualization.Name: TIBCO Data Virtualization
TIBCO Data Virtualization.Description: Data federation system for heterogeneous sources, with data caching & security, massively parallel processing & GUI tools (formerly Composite, then Cisco Data Virtualization)

Trino.Name: Trino
Trino.Description: SQL-based query distributed engine for interactive big data analytics, forked from Presto

Virtuoso.Name: Virtuoso
Virtuoso.Description: Multi-model DB (object-relational, RDF, XML) with data federation facilities

Manual provision of source metadata.Comment: e.g., VoID, Sevod, Service descriptions, DARQ
